titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Eugenia B. Bohlke (d. 2001) was a Research Associate in Ichthyology at the Academy of Natural Sciences. She entered Stanford University as a pre-med student, but switched from biology to chemistry in graduate school. She married James Bohlke and started a family, returning to the laboratory when her oldest son started college. Instead of working as a chemist, she returned to biology, accepting a position as a technician in the Ichthology Department of the Academy of Natural Sciences. She joined the department in 1954, along with her husband James, who took on the curatorship of the department. During her career at the Academy, Eugenia Bohlke became a recognized expert in the biology of eels.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of publication records for Catalog of Type Specimens, including annotated manuscripts; incoming and outgoing correspondence about identification of types, the exchange and loan of specimens, and editorial matters; reviewer comments. The collection also includes publication records for the Fishes of Western North Atlantic, including correspondence about the identification and exchange of specimens, and a set of illustrations from volume 9 of the series.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
